segment.source: Publishes the contents of an entire package.
segment.target: Publishes the contents of an entire package.

segment.source: User-visible and user-friendly name for the package.
segment.target: User-visible and user-friendly name for the package.

segment.source: The path or URL of the manifest file that lists the applications included in the package and all of their publishing information.
segment.target: The path or URL of the manifest file that lists the applications included in the package and all of their publishing information.

segment.source: If present, the package will be available for all users on this computer.
segment.target: If present, the package will be available for all users on this computer.

segment.source: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name.
segment.target: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name.

segment.source: If specified, output is presented in the active console window (default).
segment.target: If specified, output is presented in the active console window (default).

segment.source: If specified, output is presented in a Windows dialog box.
segment.target: If specified, output is presented in a Windows dialog box.

segment.source: For version 4.6, the following option has been added.
segment.target: For version 4.6, the following option has been added.

segment.source: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name in UNICODE format.
segment.target: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name in UNICODE format.

segment.source: The package must already have been added to the Application Virtualization Client, and the manifest file is required.
segment.target: The package must already have been added to the Application Virtualization Client, and the manifest file is required.

segment.source: To use the GLOBAL parameter, the PUBLISH PACKAGE command must be run as local Administrator; otherwise, only ManageTypes and PublishShortcut permissions are needed.
segment.target: To use the GLOBAL parameter, the PUBLISH PACKAGE command must be run as local Administrator; otherwise, only ManageTypes and PublishShortcut permissions are needed.

segment.source: Publishing without the GLOBAL parameter grants the user access to the applications in the package and publishes the file types and shortcuts listed in the manifest to the user’s profile.
segment.target: Publishing without the GLOBAL parameter grants the user access to the applications in the package and publishes the file types and shortcuts listed in the manifest to the user’s profile.

segment.source: Publishing with the GLOBAL parameter adds the file types and shortcuts listed in the manifest to the “All Users” profile.
segment.target: Publishing with the GLOBAL parameter adds the file types and shortcuts listed in the manifest to the “All Users” profile.

segment.source: If the package is not global before the call and the GLOBAL parameter is used, the package is made global and available to all users.
segment.target: If the package is not global before the call and the GLOBAL parameter is used, the package is made global and available to all users.
